required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: TECOS: A Randomized, Placebo Controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate Cardiovascular Outcomes After Treatment With Sitagliptin in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Inadequate Glycemic Control

collaborator.agency: Duke Clinical Research Institute, Oxford Diabetes Trials Unit

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a clinical trial designed to assess the cardiovascular outcome of long-term treatment with sitagliptin used as part of usual care compared to usual care without sitagliptin in participants with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) having a history of cardiovascular (CV) disease and a hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) of 6.5% to 8.0%.
Primary hypothesis A is that sitagliptin, when used as part of usual care, is non-inferior to usual care without sitagliptin with regard to the risk of developing a confirmed event in the primary CV composite endpoint of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) plus. If hypothesis A is satisfied: hypothesis B is that sitagliptin, when used as part of usual care, is superior to usual care without sitagliptin with regard to the risk of developing a confirmed event in the primary CV composite endpoint.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed Cardiovascular (CV) Event of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) Plus (Per Protocol Population)
primary_outcome.description: Primary composite CV endpoint of MACE plus which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, or unstable angina requiring hospitalization.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed CV Event of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) Plus (Intent to Treat Population)
primary_outcome.description: Primary composite CV endpoint of MACE plus which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, or unstable angina requiring hospitalization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed CV Event of MACE (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: CV composite endpoint of MACE which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, or nonfatal stroke.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed CV Event of MACE (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: CV composite endpoint of MACE which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, or nonfatal stroke.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Incidence of All-cause Mortality (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent incidence of all-cause mortality is reported as the percentage of participants who died due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Incidence of All-cause Mortality (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent incidence of all-cause mortality is reported as the percentage of participants who died due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Incidence of Congestive Heart Failure (CHF) Requiring Hospitalization (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent incidence of CHF requiring hospitalization was reported as the percentage of participants who were admitted to the hospital for CHF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Incidence of CHF Requiring Hospitalization (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Percent incidence of CHF requiring hospitalization was reported as the percentage of participants who were admitted to the hospital for CHF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Renal Function Over Time (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in renal function based on estimated glomerular filtration rate [eGFR] using the Modification of Diet in Renal Disease [MDRD] method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Renal Function Over Time (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in renal function based on eGFR using the MDRD method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c Over Time (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is a measure of the percentage of glycated hemoglobin in the blood. Estimated mean difference between sitagliptin and placebo controlling for baseline HbA1c and region.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c Over Time (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is a measure of the percentage of glycated hemoglobin in the blood. Estimated mean difference between sitagliptin and placebo controlling for baseline HbA1c and region.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urine Albumin:Creatinine Ratio Over Time (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the difference between the urine albumin:creatinine ratio reported time point and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urine Albumin:Creatinine Ratio Over Time (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the difference between the urine albumin:creatinine ratio reported time point and baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Initiated Chronic Insulin Therapy (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Chronic insulin therapy is defined as a continuous period of insulin use of more than 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Initiated Chronic Insulin Therapy (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: Chronic insulin therapy is defined as a continuous period of insulin use of more than 3 months.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Initiation of Co-interventional Agent (Per Protocol Population)
secondary_outcome.description: In participants not receiving insulin at baseline, time to addition of first co-interventional agent (i.e., next oral antihyperglycemic agent [AHA] or chronic insulin, where chronic insulin therapy is defined as a continuous period of insulin use of more than 3 months.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Initiation of Co-interventional Agent (Intent to Treat Population)
secondary_outcome.description: In participants not receiving insulin at baseline, time to addition of first co-interventional agent (i.e., next oral AHA or chronic insulin, where chronic insulin therapy is defined as a continuous period of insulin use of more than 3 months.)

arm_group.description: Sitagliptin tablet taken orally once daily in the morning for up to approximately 5 years.
Placebo to sitagliptin tablet taken orally once daily in the morning for up to approximately 5 years.

intervention.description: Sitagliptin, one 50 mg or one 100 mg tablet (dose dependant on renal function) orally, once daily.
Placebo tablet matching the 50 mg or 100 mg sitagliptin tablet, orally, once daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has T2DM
- Has HbA1c between 6.5% (48 mmol/mol) and 8.0% (64 mmol/mol) on stable dose(s) of antihyperglycemic agent(s), including insulin
- Has pre-existing cardiovascular disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus or ketoacidosis.
- Is not able to take sitagliptin

results_reference.citation: Green JB, Bethel MA, Paul SK, Ring A, Kaufman KD, Shapiro DR, Califf RM, Holman RR. Rationale, design, and organization of a randomized, controlled Trial Evaluating Cardiovascular Outcomes with Sitagliptin (TECOS) in patients with type 2 diabetes and established cardiovascular disease. Am Heart J. 2013 Dec;166(6):983-989.e7. doi: 10.1016/j.ahj.2013.09.003. Epub 2013 Oct 23.

Bethel MA, Green JB, Milton J, Tajar A, Engel SS, Califf RM, Holman RR; TECOS Executive Committee. Regional, age and sex differences in baseline characteristics of patients enrolled in the Trial Evaluating Cardiovascular Outcomes with Sitagliptin (TECOS). Diabetes Obes Metab. 2015 Apr;17(4):395-402. doi: 10.1111/dom.12441. Epub 2015 Feb 13.

Green JB, Bethel MA, Armstrong PW, Buse JB, Engel SS, Garg J, Josse R, Kaufman KD, Koglin J, Korn S, Lachin JM, McGuire DK, Pencina MJ, Standl E, Stein PP, Suryawanshi S, Van de Werf F, Peterson ED, Holman RR; TECOS Study Group. Effect of Sitagliptin on Cardiovascular Outcomes in Type 2 Diabetes. N Engl J Med. 2015 Jul 16;373(3):232-42. doi: 10.1056/NEJMoa1501352. Epub 2015 Jun 8. Erratum in: N Engl J Med. 2015 Aug 6;373(6):586.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 14,671 participants were randomized to treatment, provided consent and did not have any Good Clinical Practice (GCP) deviations.

group.description: Sitagliptin tablet taken orally once daily in the morning for up to approximately 5 years

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: Age is unknown for 320 participants

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
measure.description: Sitagliptin, n= 7254; Placebo, n= 7274; Total, n=14528

measure.title: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.description: Sitagliptin, n= 7330; Placebo, n= 7336; Total, n= 14666

measure.title: Urine albumin creatinine ratio
measure.description: Sitagliptin, n= 2606; Placebo, n= 2542; Total, n= 5148

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed Cardiovascular (CV) Event of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) Plus (Per Protocol Population)
outcome.description: Primary composite CV endpoint of MACE plus which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, or unstable angina requiring hospitalization.
outcome.population: Per protocol population included all randomized participants who received study medication except those participants who did not contribute at least 1 day of data to the study analysis due to a major protocol violation that excluded all of their data.

group.title: Sitagliptin
group.description: Sitagliptin tablet taken orally once daily in the morning for up to approximately 5 years

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablet taken orally once daily in the morning for up to approximately 5 years

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed Cardiovascular (CV) Event of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) Plus (Per Protocol Population)
measure.description: Primary composite CV endpoint of MACE plus which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, or unstable angina requiring hospitalization.
measure.population: Per protocol population included all randomized participants who received study medication except those participants who did not contribute at least 1 day of data to the study analysis due to a major protocol violation that excluded all of their data.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Hazard Ratio of Sitagliptin/Placebo: the between-treatment difference in time to the first primary composite CV outcome measure was assessed by the hazard ratio between the sitagliptin and placebo groups. The confidence interval for the hazard ratio was computed and compared to 1.30, the non-inferiority margin.
analysis.method_desc: Model stratified by region with treatment group only as explanatory variable.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With First Confirmed CV Event of Major Adverse Cardiovascular Event (MACE) Plus (Intent to Treat Population)
outcome.description: Primary composite CV endpoint of MACE plus which includes CV-related death, nonfatal MI, nonfatal stroke, or unstable angina requiring hospitalization.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population included all randomized participants who received study medication, provided consent, and did not have a major GCP deviation.

outcome.population: Per protocol population included all randomized participants who received study medication except those participants who did not contribute at least 1 day of data to the study analysis due to a major protocol violation that excluded all of their data. certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study at least 30 days prior to submission for publication/presentation or at least 14 calendar days prior to submission for abstracts.
